title: Use of Function Arctan
text:
It's easy to know that arctan(1/2) + arctan(1/3) = arctan(1). Given number A,  write a program to calculate the minimum sum B+C. A, B and C are all positive integers and satisfy the equation below:arctan(1/A) = arctan(1/B) + arctan(1/C)InputThe first line contains a integer number T (about 1000). T lines follow, each contains a single integer A, 1 ≤ A ≤ 60000.OutputT lines, each contains a single integer which denotes to the minimum sum B+C.ExampleSample input:1
1Sample output:5Added some new test data.
